nodes:
USAGE:
	nodes -h 
	nodes [-u <node UUID>] [-s <manage/unmanaged>] [-c <chassis UUID>] [-v <view filter name>]

OPTIONS:
	-h		This option displays command usage information
	-u, --uuid	node uuid
	-s, --status	nodes manage status (managed/unmanaged)
	-c, --chassis	chassis uuid
	-v, --view	view filter name
chassis:
USAGE:
	chassis -h
	chassis [-u <chassis UUID>] [-v <view filter name>]

OPTIONS:
	-h		This option displays command usage information
	-u, --uuid	chassis uuid
	-s, --status	chassis manage status (managed/unmanaged)
	-v, --view	view filter name

OPTIONS:

	-c, --chassis	chassis uuid
	-v, --view	view filter name

scalablesystem:
USAGE:
	scalablesystem -h
	scalablesystem [-i <scalablesystem id>] [-t <scalablesystem type>] [-s <status>] [-v <view filter name>]

OPTIONS:
	-h		This option displays command usage information
	-i, --id	scalable complex id
	-t, --type	type (flex/rackserver)
	-s, --status	scalable system manage status (managed/unmanaged)
	-v, --view	view filter name
connect:
USAGE:
	connect -h | --help 
	connect -l <URL> -u <USER> [--noverify] 

OPTIONS:
	-h		This option displays command usage information
	-l, --url	URL of LXCA
	-u, --user	Username to authenticate
	--noverify	Do not verify the server certificate for https URLs
log: Get/set log level of Python LXCA

USAGE:
	log -h | --help 
	log [-l <level>] 

OPTIONS:
		-l, --lvl	Logging level
ostream: Set ostream level of PYLXCA Interactive Shell
jobs:
USAGE:
	jobs -h | --help 
	jobs  [-i <job id>][-u <uuid of endpoint>][-s <jobs state>][-c <cancels the job with specified id>][-d <delete the job with specified id>]

	optional arguments:
	-i, --id=	job id
	-u, --uuid=	uuid of endpoint for which jobs should be retrieved
	-s, --state=	job state to retrieve jobs in specified state
	-c, --cancel	cancel job of specified id
	-d, --delete	delete job of specified id
manage:
USAGE:
	manage  -h | --help 
	manage  -i <IP Address of endpoint> -u <user ID to access the endpoint> 
		-p <current password to access the endpoint> -r <recovery password for the endpoint> 
		-m <list of endpoint management ports> -t <type of endpoint to be managed>
	manage 
			-j <job ID>

OPTIONS:
	-i, --ip	One or more IP addresses for each endpoint to be managed.
	-u, --user	user ID to access the endpoint
	-p, --pw	The current password to access the endpoint.
	-r, --rpw	The recovery password to be used for the endpoint.
	-m, --mp	A list of endpoint management ports, it is a comma separated
			list of properties which includes protocol, port number and 
			boolean flag of whether the port enabled (True/False) respectively. properties 
			should be separate by colon. See the discovey request job response 
			body for the supported protocols for the endpoint's management ports. 
	-t, --type	Type of endpoint to be managed. This can be one of the following values:
				Chassis
				Lenovo ThinkServer
				Lenovo Storage
				Rackswitch
				Rack-Tower Server
	-j, --job	Job ID of existing manage request
unmanage:
USAGE:
	unmanage [-i <IP Address of endpoint>][-j <job ID>]

	optional arguments:
	-i, --ip	One or more IP addresses for each endpoint to be unmanaged.
	-j, --job	Job ID of unmanage request
discover: Retrieve a list of devices discovered by SLP discovery.

USAGE:
	discover [-i <IP Address of endpoint>][-j <job ID>]

	optional arguments:
	-i, --ip	One or more IP addresses for each endpoint to be discovered.
	-j, --job	Job ID of discover request
configpattern: Retrieve information about all server and category patterns that have been defined in the Lenovo XClarity Administrator.
configprofile: Retrieve information about server profiles from the Lenovo XClarity Administrator.
configtarget: Retrieve a list of deployable target systems according to their server pattern and profile.

USAGE:
	configtarget [-i <ID of specific profile or pattern>]
update: Firmware update actions on target endpoints and retrieve the status and progress of firmware updates and firmware repository.

USAGE:
	update [-a <Action to take>] [-r/-f select repository or firmware for action]
user: Retrieve information about user account of Lenovo XClarity Administrator.

USAGE:
	user [-i <unique ID of the user to be retrieved>]
ffdc: Collect and export the first failure data capture (FFDC) data for a specific managed endpoint (CMM, server, storage node, or switch).

USAGE:
	ffdc [-u <UUID of the target endpoint>]
lxcalog: Retrieve hardware and management-server events in the events log.

USAGE:
	lxcalog [-f < events that apply to the specified filters >]
